name: Flavour Of Jamaica
description: Take a journey through time and get an authentic taste of the island at one of Jamaica’s oldest estates, Prospect Plantation. A warm Jamaican welcome awaits you under the estate’s great Mahogany Tree, which was planted by Sir Winston Churchill in 1953. Then enjoy a scenic stroll through the plantation’s lush gardens laden with herbs and tropical plants. Your journey leads you to amazing panoramic views of the Caribbean for some stunning photo ops. Then it's off to the Great House, once a fort, where you’ll cook up some mouth-watering Jamaican dishes–jerk chicken, steamed callaloo, festivals and coconut shrimp ‘Run Down’–with the help of Chef “Irie.” The best part: Lunch will be served under a shaded tree on the estate’s lawn! This educational, relaxing and tantalizing tour is truly a must.
